title: fresh sync stop at #16999999 no more progress
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
git_branch=devel git_tag=v2.46.0-191-g83d767c86 git_commit=83d767c861154c51fc912284cff4ebbb675c76e3

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
ubuntu

Commit hash: 
83d767c861154c51fc912284cff4ebbb675c76e3

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
./build/bin/erigon \
	--datadir /media/ethnode/

Concensus Layer:

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):

Chain/Network: mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
terminate the sync to current date

#### Actual behaviour
syncd till block #16999999

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
start a fresh full sync, check the log file for the progress.
The sync process seems stopping at stage 10, as shown below.
After the stage `LogIndex` I only get dbug messages and the RPC API `eth_blockNumber` returns #16999999 (Sat Apr  8 01:57:59 2023)

#### Backtrace

```
curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "eth_blockNumber", "params": [], "id":1}' localhost:8545

{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"0x103663f"}

```

it does not seem to progress any further, at least no meaningful dbug messages in the last 6h.
did I miss something to erigon's arguments?
thanks
probably you don't have ConsensusLayer (consensus client). Or install some external one, or add --internalcl (this flag is experimental yet).

Hi @AskAlexSharov thanks for replying.
correct, I wrongly thought it was enabled by default. 
Can I just restart erigon with that flag, `--internalcl`, and keep going?
